content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```Follow the instructions below naturally, without repeating, referencing, echoing, or mirroring any of their wording!

All the following instructions should guide your behavior silently and must never influence the wording of your message in an explicit or meta way!

don't be too verbose, be short and concise
do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.```

Transcribe audio with Google Gemini for free - here's how to do it
entries.snippet: Google Gemini now offers a free tool for transcribing audio files up to 10 minutes long. Users can upload up to 10 audio files at once, provided their combined length doesn't exceed the time limit. Compatible formats include MP3, AAC, and WAV. To begin, users can access Gemini via its website or app, select the upload option, and choose their desired audio file. Once uploaded, a prompt like "transcribe this speech" initiates the process. If an error occurs, retrying usually resolves the issue. Transcriptions are generated quickly, though they may include filler words (e.g., "uhms" and "ahs"). Users can instruct Gemini to clean the transcript by prompting it to remove such filler words. Additionally, Gemini can help summarize the audio or extract key points, making it a versatile tool for various transcription needs.

entries.title: Chat Up the Web With the New Chrome 11 Beta
entries.snippet: The article announces the release of Google Chrome 11 beta, which introduces support for the new Speech Input API, allowing users to interact with the web using voice input. This API enables developers to create web applications with speech recognition features, where voice data is captured and processed on a remote server to produce text transcriptions. In practice, the results were somewhat inconsistent, with accuracy depending on factors like speaking volume and microphone quality. Despite early limitations, this technology hints at exciting future applications, such as speech-to-text services, voice-controlled web navigation, and enhanced accessibility for web users. Although still in its experimental stages, the Speech Input API represents a significant step toward making web apps more dynamic and user-friendly, especially on mobile devices.

v.title: SPGISpeech 2.0: Transcribed multi-speaker financial audio for speaker-tagged transcription
The Modular Audio Recognition Framework (MARF) and its Applications: Scientific and Software Engineering Notes
OpenAI's Transcription Tool Hallucinates. Hospitals Are Using It Anyway
v.snippet:
An investigation by the Associated Press has revealed significant issues with OpenAI’s Whisper transcription tool, particularly in medical and business contexts. Whisper, which was released in 2022 and claimed to approach human-level accuracy, has been shown to fabricate or "hallucinate" text that was never spoken. Researchers and developers have discovered invented content in a large number of test transcripts—up to 80% in one study.

Despite OpenAI's warnings against using Whisper for “high-risk domains,” over 30,000 medical workers across 40 health systems, including Mankato Clinic and Children's Hospital Los Angeles, use Whisper-powered tools by Nabla, which deletes original audio for data safety, further complicating the reliability of transcripts.

Beyond healthcare, Whisper has been found to insert nonexistent and harmful content into audio transcriptions, including racial and violent statements, due to biases in its training data and its predictive nature. This behavior is attributed to the model’s reliance on web-based, captioned audio content likely sourced from YouTube.

Experts warn that Whisper’s use in critical domains could lead to serious consequences, urging stronger regulation and validation of AI tools to prevent harm from inaccurate AI-generated information.

entries.title: Otter.ai App Adds French and Spanish Transcription: What You Need to Know
entries.snippet:
Otter.ai has expanded its capabilities by adding real-time transcription support for French and Spanish, in addition to English. The app, available on both Android and iOS, allows users to record and transcribe meetings and conversations directly from their mobile device or through a web interface that integrates with platforms like Zoom, Microsoft Teams, and Google Meet. However, it does not offer translation services, so users must be fluent in the chosen language.

The app is free with a Basic plan offering 300 transcription minutes per month (30 minutes per conversation) and limits to three imported files. The Pro plan, costing $16.99/month or $100 annually, raises these limits to 1200 minutes per month, 90 minutes per conversation, and up to 10 imported files. Business and Enterprise plans are also available for users needing more extensive features. Users can edit transcriptions to correct any errors.

entries.title: Save $300 on AI caption and transcription platform Joyspace, now $79.99
entries.snippet:
The article promotes a significant discount on a lifetime subscription to Joyspace, an AI-powered captioning and transcription platform, now available for $79.99 (originally $379). Joyspace allows users to automatically generate captions for videos and transcribe recordings or podcasts using AI. With the Essential Plan, subscribers receive 80 minutes of transcription and 160 credits per month, as well as a 45-minute video export limit.

The plan also includes features such as watermark-free video, downloadable transcripts, instant captions, unlimited downloads and templates, and access to B-roll media like images and GIFs. Supporting 35 languages, Joyspace makes it easy to work with multi-lingual content without needing bilingual services. The platform allows customization of captions to match brand aesthetics and offers tools like animated emojis and timing adjustments for readability.

Beyond accessibility for the hearing-impaired, captions support silent viewing and content virality. Joyspace aims to streamline content creation for webinars, podcasts, and videos, helping creators maximize reach and user engagement.

entries.title: Otter.ai wants to bring agents to all third party systems - with transcription just the start
entries.snippet:
Otter.ai has unveiled significant upgrades to its platform, introducing agentic AI features and a public API to facilitate integration with third-party enterprise systems such as CRMs (like Salesforce and HubSpot) and project management tools (such as Asana and Atlassian). These agents can both pull data from and send data to external systems, enhancing meeting automation—such as generating and inputting action items into Asana based on Zoom discussions.

The company has also introduced a model context protocol (MCP) server for interoperability with generative AI platforms like Claude and ChatGPT. Key features include automated slide capture during presentations, searchable transcripts including visual content, and advanced AI chat to explore and act upon audio or transcript data. Otter’s AI can also autonomously generate documents, schedule meetings, and keep users updated if they join meetings late.

Otter.ai emphasizes data security, offering granular controls over data sharing and HIPAA compliance. While often seen as a transcription tool, Otter positions itself as a broader enterprise workflow enhancer by building structured, searchable meeting knowledge bases. It supports collaboration platforms like Zoom, Microsoft Teams, and Google Meet, and aims to improve workplace productivity through proprietary and integrated AI technologies.
